Reviews.Title: “Dirty bedroom, horrible breakfast and front desk”
Reviews.Author: mah10000
Reviews.Content: The check in was professional and quick but the room carpet was dirty (old clothing labels from old passengers between the beds, dirty spots and stains), the beds were OK but the breakfast is HORRIBLE. Tthe area is small and DISGUSTING DIRTY, the microwave was disgusting, impossible to use, the pancake area messy and dirty, the juice machine only give colored water, the used foam cups were in a sink on the side in place of trashed... when we asked the front lady to help us with the juice and clean the area and replenish the bread section she replied that the area will be cleaned after 9 when the breakfast finish and the juice is supposed to be perfect... in brief very RUDE and LAZY, she finished the conversation with a very unprofessional have a good day. Very disappointing, i wasn't expecting luxury but for sure a clean room and a decent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience in my lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: ABMedd4
Reviews.Content: The room #320 I was given was horrible. I was going to bed and there was this strong smell of pee. There was a moderate pee stain in the bed. The staff at this hotel were rude and unprofessional. They expected us to be happy and pay full price. I will Never stay at a best western again!! I have filed a complaint with the BBB. And with Bestwestern.com I will continue to write reviews on as many sites as possible. I have pictures and video.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Walter F
Reviews.Content: Nice size room, good bed, exercise equip available, convenient parking - but - lacking is the breakfast area. . .was our most expensive Best Western stay (of 7) on a 9 day trip - but - decent .

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: ceme53
Reviews.Content: recently remodeled very quiet easy access from freeway

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: TNedge
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my college aged daughter when we went to a Grizzlies BB game. Rooms are old and dated, lobby smells very bad and these guys are cheap, cheap, cheap. My daughter headed down to breakfast at 8:30 am . No coffee and she asked them to make some , they ignored her. Another lady asked the woman at the desk and no answer she just walked down a hall. I came down 10 min later and asked. Nothing happened. 10 min later after I was almost done with breakfast I asked again and was told by the womans husband that it was now 10 min until breakfast was over and they told me they would not make more coffee because they had to make 25 cups at one time. Oh my goodness, so no coffee for breakfast!!!! She said if I wanted coffee I had to go to my room and make it!. As a Best Western Diamond member I stay at many Best westerns a year. I have never stayed at such an awful , rude hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap in everything but price”
Reviews.Author: PaigeMitts
Reviews.Content: There's a reason this is close to last in ratings. Worst service! The room itself was large and had potential but that's where it ends. We travel for a living. Stay in hotels 60 days straight and this is the first really bad review I've written. The towels were stained and one of them had a hole in it the size of my fist. Sheets were so worn there were holes in them. We tried to call the front desk for more but no one answered when we let it ring repeatedly. Big sign out front says high speed Internet but it wasn't wireless. I asked and the guy at front said they were required by Best Western to have hard wired Internet. Horse crap. I stayed in three other best westerns this week and they all had wireless. I actually took the towels to the front to show them and told the we had called but he said no way, they had been there the whole time as if we were lying. Hotel lobby and stairwell stinks of the heavily spiced food they must be cooking. There is a reason 90% of people would not recommend this hotel. I w

Reviews.Title: “best western should close the hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve555Austin
Reviews.Content: Know one answered the phone. Fax and phone same number--desk clerk never on duty.... breakfast was terrible quality gravy was e water.... breakfast room was cold outside doors always open..bed poor mattress AS YOU CAN SEE MY WIFE AND I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL FOR ANYONE... EVEN AT A LOWER PRICE I WOULD RATHER STAY IN A RAT TRAP

Reviews.Title: “OMG - find anything else but this one!!”
Reviews.Author: Katieelder
Reviews.Content: This was the first place we stayed at on our way to AZ - it was a convenient place to stop right off the highway. We were dead tired and didn't have time to leave and find another place - wish we would have!! It really grossed us out. The clue should have been upon entering the lobby -- strong odor of curry mixed with the smell of the dirty floors. I can't get the smell out of my nose even now. The woman at the front desk was so rude and unhelpful and acted like she was doing us a giant favor by letting us stay there. Not enough towels in the rooms for two people, mattress was lumpy and dirty underneath the pad...uggghh. We were glad to leave in the morning! Now I know, just because it says "Best Western" doesn't mean a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice, clean, and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: vanenglish
Reviews.Content: We'd made reservations at the new-looking La Quinta next door, but when we arrived, there was a long line of bikers standing at the front desk, all checking in, apparently without reservations, and the sole desk clerk was swamped. David stood in line while I walked next door to the Best Western, which looked very clean. First thing I saw was a sign that said "No Pets," which gave me pause because we were traveling with our seven-pound papillon. Nonetheless, I spoke with the clerk and asked for his best available rate, which happened to be the same as the La Quinta. Free wifi, all suites, sounded good. "But you don't accept pets," I said to the clerk. He asked what kind of pet, size, etc., and then said it would be okay as long as the dog stayed in his carrier the whole time. I asked to see a room, so he gave me a key to a room on the second floor and I was so pleasantly surprised. I called David immediately. He was still standing in line behind the bikers. He called La Quinta's 800 number and cancelled our reservation; we checked into the Best Western. The air conditioning was excellent; the mattress was firm; the pillows were abundant and fluffy; the decor was a little overdone but everything was SO CLEAN. This was a suite--or what today goes as a suite: There was a sitting area with loveseat, lounge chair, and desk as one entered the room; then through an archway, one enters the sleeping area. The bathroom fixtures, granite countertops, and furniture all looked new. There wasn't actually wifi; an Ethernet cord was required. But this hotel was close enough to the La Quinta that we could tap into its network. The hotel was also VERY quiet, with what seemed to be a nice clientele. I went back down to the front desk to compliment the clerk and found him talking to a couple of the bikers who had been in line at the La Quinta. He was telling them they were welcome to stay but absolutely forbid their revving the engines of their motorcycles in the parking lot! (Very courteous of the other guests, in my book.)

Reviews.Title: “Management an absolute diasaster - run!”
Reviews.Author: Clive_Ferreira
Reviews.Content: Management is all about the money and full of tricks. Don't care about the needs of their guests. Outright refuse to listen or accommodate simple needs. They should not be in the hospitality business but may be better suited for a veggie/fish market. Lied about cleaning room, breakfast is a joke unless you like having only the choice of white or whole wheat bread with butter, no high speed internet, printer broken, lobby shabby and you're expected to have breakfast there as there are strick rules about eating in your room, exercise equipment not in working order - dangerous to use and we go on. Female Manager (Susan) is ignorant and unqualified to provide effective customer service. She lied several times to us then told us that she is not obligated to tell us the truth. Seriously, run to another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap beds, older rooms, not as clean as it should be.”
Reviews.Author: G0Pirates
Reviews.Content: Not a good value for the money. Outside entry rooms, older beds and bedspreads, housekeeping not doing a very good job. Management would not help out with cost after all night party in next room kept me up all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Stay CLEAR of this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: LouisianaLizzy
Reviews.Content: I was leaving AR, stopping in Memphis then heading South to LA so I thought this hotel was right off of I-40. I was wrong - my mistake. I checked in at midnight and when I walked in the room it looked okay. I checked to make sure the sheets on the bed were clean, they were, but the blanket (the thin one that is in between the sheet and comforter) was COVERED with hair. The bathroom was not up to par. The toilet seat had droplets of pee on it along w/a little poo. I took out my small can of lysol and disinfected it along w/the tub since that had a little hair in it from whoever that had stayed in the room prior to me coming in. I was utterly grossed out!! I would have left then BUT I had an infant w/all the "stuff" that goes along that we dragged up to the room (3rd floor) and was exhausted. I figured I would take it up w/the manager the next morning. When I checked out the next morning I told the front desk clerk (only person there) about the problem, and said that they needed to pay their cleaning people more. She never apologized, never offered a discount, nothing. She responded ,quite proudly I might add, that their cleaning people get paid $8.50 an hour. I have sworn off any Best Western's for the rest of my life and will gladly pay a lot more to stay at a Hampton Inn or Hilton. You get what you pay for, I suppose. I paid approx $75 and that is relatively a small amount of money, but ...it's the point. Why should I pay that amount for something that the manager of the hotel would not sleep in himself? Don't they take any pride in it?? Wouldn't you want to feel confident about the place knowing you have the best price, okay location (depending on what direction you're coming from) and a decent staff to help the clients?? Apparently not. The two indian workers I dealt with were both arrogant and I will NEVER ever ever stay at a b/w again.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 6045 Macon Cove, Memphis, TN 38134
